figure.figDesc: Photograph of a page from Schenker's diaries

p.hi: Page of Schenker's diary: late January and early February 1907

div.p: This diary page, p. 33, contains entries for seven days, Sunday January 27 to Wednesday February 6, 1907. Written in Heinrich's tiny old-fashioned "Sütterlinschrift" hand, with deletions, corrections, and marginal marks in pen and crayon, it includes a notorious passage: his outspoken reaction to Schoenberg's first string quartet. [IB IS GOING TO SUPPLY MORE TEXT FOR THIS PAGE]
